intro: Tephrosia angustissima var. angustissima, commonly known as narrowleaf tephrosia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems and alternate, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in summer, followed by slender, woody pods containing small, dark seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fallow fields. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and potential medicinal applications.
